intro: Lobelia exilis var. major, commonly known as the tall lobelia, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and clusters of blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and thrives in partial to full shade. It produces small, tubular flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Lobelia exilis var. major is often used in native plant gardens for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
